channel.title: Windows 7 - Client crashing after few seconds
channel.description:
I Know, this was done once before I guess, but since people couldn't find the Windows 7 Convertor, here's one, since I got it a year ago.
I'll explain how to use it to fix this problem.
[url=http://uppit.com/wy15hvovt7ps/Windows_7_Converter.rar]Download[/url] Guide;
Open the Convertor, and click on the "..." at the batch directory.
Open your client files, and open your "Run.bat" "Start.bat" "Initialize.bat" (I don't know which name you are using so..)
Then just click on the "Compile" button, and that's it, it won't cause crashes anymore.
Program Features:
[ul][li]Visibility[/li] [li]Working Directory[/li] [li]Temporary files[/li] [li]Encryption[/li] [li]Miscellanous[/li] [li]Compile[/li] [li]Reset[/li][/ul]
Enjoy, hope this in the RIGHT section though.

[/quote]
